snippet: As Israelis go to the polls, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s stance is being seen as a push to appeal to right-wing voters. His chief challenger supports the two-state solution.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu declares definitively that if reelected he will never establish Palestinian state, in last-minute bid to appeal to country's right-wing voters; declaration is reversal of Netanyahu's endorsement of two-state solution, and confirms many world leaders' suspicions that he was never serious about peace negotiations with Palestinians; stance will complicate relations with United States should Netanyahu emerge victorious in elections.
lead_paragraph: As Israelis go to the polls, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s stance is being seen as a push to appeal to right-wing voters. His chief challenger supports the two-state solution.

headline.main: Netanyahu Says No to Statehood for Palestinians
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu Says No to Statehood for Palestinians
